result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin R. Malvick

defendant.name: Malvick, Kevin R.
defendant.address: W7592 County Road F, Antigo, WI 54409

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM/Room 301.  Defendant Kevin R. Malvick appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail; appearance by Zoom. Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court, in person, for Kevin R. Malvick.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court via Zoom for the State of Wisconsin. 21CF179 and 22CF120. Court has reviewed Attny Laufenberg's motion. Attny Laufenberg heard on bond modification request, asking for $25,000 bond. Court in recess at 10:04 a.m. On the record at 10:06 a.m. Court indicates for the record that victim is in courtroom and had conversation with Attny Laufenberg. Counsel summarizes victim's request for no contact. State recites position, objects to amount being requested by defense. Response by Attorney Laufenberg. Court questions victim. Remarks by the Court. The Court will not modify bond; Counsel may revisit bond issue at later time. State has complied with victim rights. State indicates a global offer has been made but will defer to counsel as to what type of hearing should be set. Attny Laufenberg has not received offer, asks that it be resent. State will do so.  STC to be set for Nov. 21 at 11 a.m. State indicates for the record that Def. walked away prior to hearing being scheduled.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:56 PM Defendant Kevin R. Malvick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Kevin R. Malvick.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kevin R. Malvick appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Kevin R. Malvick.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Malvick has copy of complaint, waives reading and waives time limits for p.h.  Def. waives time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver of time limits. State would request to track other case. Court calls 21CF179. Atty Laufenberg was just retained and makes statement.  Parties discussion.  Reason calling set for 8-3 for bond and State request both case track each other and send out notices to victims. 22CF120 Victim rights complied.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 024926,

2:32 PM Defendant Kevin R. Malvick in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. makes statement on court appointed attorney.  Def. will hire own atty.  State is compliance with victim rights.  State gives bail/bond recommendations. Def. makes statement. Court orders $50,000 Signature bond with condition Take medication as prescribed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
